Package ohos.app

Interface ElementsCallback

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbilityPackage

    public interface ElementsCallback
    Provides callbacks that can be used by elements to listen for system configuration and memory status changes.
    Since:
    3

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void onConfigurationUpdated​(Configuration configuration)
      Called when the system configuration of the device changes.
      void onMemoryLevel​(int level)
      Called when the system has determined to trim the memory, for example, when the ability is running in the background and there is no enough memory for running as many background processes as possible.

    • Method Detail

      • onMemoryLevel

        void onMemoryLevel​(int level)
        Called when the system has determined to trim the memory, for example, when the ability is running in the background and there is no enough memory for running as many background processes as possible.
        Parameters:
        level - Indicates the memory trim level, which shows the current memory usage status. The values and their respective meanings are as follows:
        • 5: The application is running properly and will not be killed, but the device is running slightly low on memory. The system may start to kill processes based on the Least Recently Used (LRU) list.
        • 10: The application is running properly and will not be killed, but the device is running extremely low on memory. Your application should release some unnecessary resources to improve system performance, which accordingly improves the application performance.
        • 15: The application is running properly, but the system has killed most of the cached processes based on the LRU list. In this case, your application should release as many unnecessary resources as possible. Otherwise, the system may continue to kill all the cached processes and start to kill some processes that should be kept running, for example, services running in the background.
        • 20: The application UI is hidden, for example, because the user touched the Home key on the device. Your application should releases resources allocated for UI display to free up memory.
        • 40: The device is running low on memory and your application is around the top of the LRU list. The system is not likely to kill your application. To keep your application processes in the cache for a longer time, your application should increase available system memory by releasing some resources that can be easily restored. In this way, your application is able to smoothly return to the foreground, instead of being restarted.
        • 60: The device is running extremely low on memory and your application is around the middle of the LRU list. Your application may be killed later if no more memory is freed up.
        • 80: The device is running extremely low on memory and your application is at the end of the LRU list. The system is most likely to kill your application first. In this case, your application should release all resources that can be released.
        Since:
        3

      • onConfigurationUpdated

        void onConfigurationUpdated​(Configuration configuration)
        Called when the system configuration of the device changes.

        This callback method is used only if the configurationChange field has been configured in the config.json file for the ability currently running in the foreground. Otherwise, the system restarts the ability instead of calling this callback method.

        Parameters:
        configuration - Indicates the new Configuration object.
        Since:
        3
